website_summaries.verdict: The big screen, 4G LTE data speeds and low price make the Motorola Moto G a solid choice both for people who want to watch movies on the move and for smartphone newbies.
pros: The Motorola Moto G's big, bright screen makes movies more immersive, the pure Android Lollipop experience is easy to use and both the camera and the battery put in decent performances
cons: Processor power is underwhelming, even for a budget phone, which makes operation sluggish at times

customer_reviews.title: SPANISH LANGUAGE
customer_reviews.text: HELP! Either Amazon or Breed (supplier) needs to send ENGLISH LANGUAGE instructions to me. This phone came with an accordion fold printout of instructions ONLY IN THE SPANISH LANGUAGE. I DO NOT speak nor read SPANISH. I CANNOT USE THIS PHONE UNTIL I RECEIVE USER INSTRUCTIONS IN THE ENGLISH LANGUAGE. I LIVE IN THE USA, THE PHONE WAS SENT TO ME AT MY HOME ADDRESS IN THE USA. WHY would I be sent a phone with ONLY SPANISH LANGUAGE INSTRUCTIONS FOR USE???
customer_reviews.author: A. Vikingsdatter

customer_reviews.title: Worst phone I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Worst phone I have ever owned. It's so incredibly slow it's irritating. Apps constantly crash, even the Caller crashes, it's pathetic. It's such an awesome device that's held hostage by its own software. I even upgraded to the latest android with a fresh install and within a few days it was back to its own madness. Now when I reboot it gets stuck 'optimizing app' for a half hour before you can use it, utterly worthless. I am purchasing a new phone and I will take great pleasure with taking a sledge hammer to this device. $180 in the hole, what a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Voice Echo Problem Unresolved
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone in 12/2019 after having a great experience with a previous Moto phone. I phone, text and do a little browsing and maps. From the start, I had problems with this phone--stopping, slow response. Those problems went away. Then people I was talking to all started (at once) saying they heard their voice echo. I swear, it must have been from an update. There is no echo if I use speaker phone. Searched for a fix and found a lot of suggestions but nothing worked. This phone has been a lot of problems. Should have returned it to Amazon at the start.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone in March... I didn't activate until a month later in April. It stopped working in June. I hadn't dropped it or damaged it in any way My first gen moto g was subjected to harsher treatments and survived. If you Google moto g2 won't boot you will see this isn't uncommon. When I contacted Motorola their options were less than appealing to me so I opted to get a new phone from a different company. I'm terribly disappointed in Motorola and they have lost one loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shit phone, spend more for something reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This phone works great. Paired it with a T-mobile plan. Had to update the review. I've had a bunch of issues with the software on this phone. The battery indicator is not working properly, and it sometimes does not boot properly. I've had to deal with the issues for while, but the last straw was this morning as it just quit working. I have NO clue why it doesn't boot properly. if I do get it running, it consistently brings up notifications that services are stopping. I'm so frustrated it's ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: L. P.

customer_reviews.title: all in all a terrible phone
customer_reviews.text: It is slow. The apps respond eventually. Data just doesn't seem to load. It was obviously meant for someone in Mexico. It came with all Spanish instructions. I was able to switch the phone to English but whenever there was any kind of message for updates it was in Spanish. Really the phone has no redeemable quality except the screen.
customer_reviews.author: kshow1954

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive phone
customer_reviews.text: We own 3 of these phones and love them. Nice, crisp display. Better-than-expected camera. Expandable memory -- be sure to add a memory card and store photos and multimedia there, as internal storage is tight. Rarely feels laggy, or much slower than my Nexus 5 which cost 2x as much.. Our oldest one is nearing 1 year old now (in teenager's hands!), and has given us no problems aside from a worn out connector on the charger. Note that the replacement for this phone has been announced and may be available for purchase now. Early reviews suggest that it is better yet.
customer_reviews.author: i_reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone.  Works with GoSmart Mobile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter (17) as her 1st cell phone. I tried it out and it seems equivalent to about a Galaxy S3/S4 without all the bloatware. Very snappy, nice looking screen and a nice looking phone. The stereo speakers are fantastic for a phone. The GPS is reasonably quick to turn on navigation apps. It's a little thicker than a premium phone but not so much that I'd call it a big con. Hooked it up to GoSmart Mobile and it works great. I used to use Motorola back in the flip phone days as their build quality was top notch. This phone seems solid as well. Can't do much better for $100 these days.
customer_reviews.author: gerald n

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone a few years ago for a senior for emergency use. The phone has at most 100minutes on it and it was not even turn on most of the time. Recently the sim card slot starts acting up and then wont recognize any sim I put in. Then the memory slot stopped working all of a sudden. I am quite surprise by the poor quality of this motorolla phone. I understand this phone is out dated by today's technology, but for a senior who only need it for emergency purpose it is more than enough. Very disappointed with Motorola phone and will consider another brand for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally leave feedback but I felt it was needed this time. EVERYTHING (box, phone,instructions) was in spanish. Even after I switch the language to english the up dates were coming in spanish. The phone itself was glitchy and froze up all the time. When I would try to open an app. the phone would take so long the screen would fall asleep 4 times. Then the phone would freeze up again. I contacted the company and they won't do a refund. So I'm stuck with a phone that doesn't work. Huge rip off!
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: Like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome phone for the price. I do confess I got this for an older gentleman and it will work for him, but, for me, I would need more gigs than 8. They just disappear with all the essential apps. Before you even put anything on it yourself, the system apps, google apps, etc have used up a good deal of you space already. False advertising, really, to say 8 gigs, but not say that the already installed and essential apps are already using a ton of those 8 gigs. Now 8 gigs apart from the apps, that would be more doable.
customer_reviews.author: Step Lively

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful- Maravilloso
customer_reviews.text: Excelente telefono su relacion precio/calidad es incomparable, tengo instalada la actualizacion de android lollipop y va de maravilla, son mas fluidas las animaciones que android kit kat.. tiene buena calidad de imagen, buen sonido.. la bateria dura perfectamente todo el dia! el mejor smartphone que he tenido..sin dudas! Excellent phone their relationship price / quality is unmatched , I installed the update of android lollipop and going great , are more fluid animations than android kit kat .. has good image quality , good sound .. perfectly battery lasts all day! the best smartphone I've had.. no doubts!
customer_reviews.author: carlos-venezuela

customer_reviews.title: but I think Ill like this for quite some time
customer_reviews.text: so far its sipping the battery which was a major concern with the 2cd generation reviews.. I have only installed a couple things so far, but I think Ill like this for quite some time.. Android on roids! I was still using my G1 which was a great unit.. I am in US and bought the global version.. no worries.. it works fine on ATT network coverage, and I've even read that it works on most of the Sprint network that it was supposed to not cover as well.. I've only had this a few days, so Ill come back if it takes a crap on me
customer_reviews.author: Always Right

customer_reviews.title: Five Star
customer_reviews.text: the moto g 2nd gen is very big. the phone is also fast haven`t had any lag. it look similar to the moto x cause of the speaker. The phone is very loud. Pros Unlocked SD card up to 32gb 5in screen dual speaker and mic 8megapixal rear camera and 2mp frontal camera good battery life garrantee update to android L* cons no LTE dont need it i got wifi No DUAL SIM FOR USA :C not that many colors but who cares.
customer_reviews.author: Acze Perez

customer_reviews.title: Motorola has won me over with their witchcraft
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone after my Nexus 4 sorta died on me. Strictly bought based on reviews and having seen a 1st gen working pretty well. After 4 weeks of using the phone, its pretty badass. I was initially worried about some specs being lower than that of the Nexus 4, and that perhaps performance was going to be bad. Boy, was I wrong. So far I like this better than the Nexus 4. Its responsive and that battery life. Its ENDLESS. I have gotten almost 20 hours out of one single charge. That alone makes this phone a superb buy. This acts like a high end phone a low price range. Kudos to motorola on this series.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Good basic smart phone.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves his new phone. It's a bit bigger and works so much better than his prior LG phone. He's happy with the way games play on the phone. And he loves the larger keyboard. It worked immediately with his existing T-Mobile SIM card. It's 3G+, not 4G LTE. But that's fast enough for him since he uses wireless most of the time anyway. This phone should last him for the next couple of years until he puts more demands on his phone when he begins high school.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good phone for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Its an excellent product that really delivered what was expected. My grandpa really needed a phone and this phone really helped him since its very basic and requires very little teaching for him to get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: james t.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing and jaw-dropping!
customer_reviews.text: There isn't enough to say about this phone. You would think that you were using a phone well into the $400 range, but you're not. This phone is extremely fast and light. I can switch between apps seamlessly, and I haven't experienced any lag yet. The only lag I've experienced was from a few very graphics intensive games, but that was just to benchmark the phone. I don't use it to game and if you don't either then this phone if perfect for you. As of yet, no hiccups or bugs or any weird problems with the phone. Everything works and performs the way it should. I love it soooo much.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Fajardo

customer_reviews.title: It is very annoying.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I choose this phone is for the expandable memory up to 32 GB. I bought extra memory and it works for a month. While I was taking picture, the error message came on about external memory became unplug. I thought I lost the picture since I when into my photo gallery and the picture was not there. I discovered later that the pictured is stored in my external memory chip but I can only see it when I put the chip into my computer desk top. Every so often the same error message notification keep popping up on my phone. It is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Curt W. Penland

customer_reviews.title: Android UI is super smooth and fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these Pro's: Android UI is super smooth and fast, there no no lag ( I do not play video games, so I cannot judge for that) One of the first to get Android updates Very good battery life Crisp clear screen Cheap price Memory upgradeable Con's: No LTE Non-removable battery Now people may say, this feels flimsy or cheap compared to a Samsung S5/Note or a HTC phone, but those are premium phones which cost 3 - 5 times more than this phone.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Love it. For most folks
customer_reviews.text: Love it. For most folks, the the Moto G (2014) delivers everything needed in an Android smartphone and at a great price. It might not win many spec chart battles but the user experience and value for money can't be beat. The only downside I found is that the phone doesn't work with my beloved Xiaomi Piston 2 headphones. I'll be purchasing a second one when the LTE version is introduced in early 2015. Edited February 2016: I now have the Moto G (2015) as well. But nothing beats the Moto G (2014) for sound quality, simplicity, near stock Android UI, and PRICE!
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: No more Amazon Fire Phone
customer_reviews.text: Had the Fire Phone which I thought was fine until I realized its limitations. No Bluetooth 4.0, anemic OS very slow. So I bought the Moto G (2nd generation). Has android 5 and Bluetooth LE. Much more responsive and allows me to sync with fitness wearables. Nice screen and pretty good audio. Has dual stereo speakers. My only negative response is Motorola's awful tech support. Otherwise a great phone for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Medco

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly simple
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone since about Christmas, so about a month and so far it is amazing. I had lost my job in October and my Samsung Galaxy died that week too, so I was without a smart phone for a couple months. I was worried about spending less because I've always bought the biggest and best. I do not regret getting this phone one bit. Admittedly I do have to keep my apps to a minimum because it is only 8G of internal which every app has to be at least partially installed on but I'm totally comfortable with that.
customer_reviews.author: AprilEngland

customer_reviews.title: mostly very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I am surprisingly satisfied with this phone. Good readable screen, good feel, pretty responsive ui. Happy that it got the 6.0 update last week. Two disappointments: 8gb internal storage doesn't allow me to keep a lot of installed apps. I have to keep juggling which apps I want to keep. I have moved every possible app I could over to sd card. Other disappointment is the text and email messages aren't playing over car bt. It did it once and then no more. Have fiddled with all possible settings with no change. Same with or without using motorola assist. Same before and after 6.0 upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: I love this new phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this new phone. Before this I had a Samsung Note1. But this phone looks much better than that. Here are the reason: 1. The screen size is good 2. The battery life is really good. I am loving it. It goes more than a day with heavy use. It may go 2 days if you use moderately. 3. It does not come with extra app. 4. THE PRICE. Only thing, motorola may add a headphone for some extra money.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Favorite phone
customer_reviews.text: This has probably been my favorite phone by far. My biggest issue was that it crapped out on me after about a year. It would not power on just stayed on the start up screen. Other than that it was fast had great memory and i really like the moto feature that allows you to transfer content from one phone to another by generating a qr code. It also had a great screen that took a lot of beating without cracking and the sound quality was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: I love this Phone!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone, but the one Amazon sent me was broken, and they did not have another one to send me, for perhaps 2 months. I bought another one at the local Best Buy store for the same price, and it is perfect. This 2nd Gen Moto G, which I bought for my wife, is even better than the original 1st generation Moto G I have for myself. Seems a little faster, battery seems to last much longer too. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this phone. I know I did not give much detail, but It just does everything very well. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: BobL

customer_reviews.title: I expected more from this phone.
customer_reviews.text: I think I expected a lot from this phone at the time of receiving it, the touch screen is not very sensitive, the quality of the screen is only acceptable, what can highlight more in this phone is the Battery. However, it is a durable phone, ideal for rough and not at all delicate people.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional phone for its price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value for a phone that I've seen for a long time. I bought this for my dad and he loves the phone to death. The build quality is very fine considering the price, and the increased screen size is very well appreciated. You shouldn't notice a difference between this screen and those Full HD screens on higher end phones. Thanks to Motorola's light skin, the phone doesn't lag one bit. It flies through tasks like a beast. If you are looking for a great smartphone or Android experience and doesn't want to spend too much on it, this is the phone for you.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned pretty much every single flashship Android phone this year (2014). This purchase was for my wife who doesn't care as much about phones as I do. I am throughly impressed with phone. It feel great to hold, the software is super smooth, the battery life is great and the speakers sound really good. And it's cheap (relatively speaking) to boot. My only gripe with this phone is the lack of LTE support. If your looking for a cheap Android phone, don't pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Well rounded phone with excellent performance -- and a bargain to boot!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT phone - the single complaint is a lack of LTE. But considering what's packed into this device, it's still a bargain for a device which performs quite well. Nicely sized display, bright screen, CPU handles everything that's been thrown at it (including many games), speakers sound GREAT, battery life is as expected, reception seems good, and a lack of tons of third-party junk (just plain Android - nothing else to interfere with the experience!) -- why aren't all phones like this? This is our 2nd Moto G, and I won't hesitate to go back for another should the need arise.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's good... Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Good phone but what hinders it from greatness is the 1 GB of RAM, which is no longer enough by today's standards, so you'll notice lag at times. Not to mention the 8 GB of storage ROM that'll require you to get a microSD card soon. Other than that, it's a good phone. Color reproduction is crisp. It's snappy when the RAM isn't choking. Android 6.0 update gives you the best experience. Battery life is nothing to brag about but wish it was removable. Waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: DarkAngelRafael

customer_reviews.title: I, personally, wasn't a fan of this phone ...
customer_reviews.text: I, personally, wasn't a fan of this phone. I've had mostly Samsung phones in the past & I guess maybe I just had trouble getting used to it. BUT I did have battery issues with it. It seemed to get quite warm when it was in use & the battery itself didn't last long enough, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Bmayfield

customer_reviews.title: T-mobile - buy Global - 12
customer_reviews.text: Works well, especially for the price point. Used the references on the amazon page to buy the US model rather than the Global for T-mobile network, that was a bad choice. No signal inside my home at all. Outside of that the phone is decent, good picture and takes decent photos. Nice phone for a backup, which is why I bought it, and will end up using as a remote with my chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: Bryn C

customer_reviews.title: great phone great price.
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat this phone for the no contract price. This is the best phone I have ever had. I know that sounds exagerated but I had iphones and the note 3. This phone is just perfect for me. The note 3 turned out to be too big (I have small hands). The iphones did not give me enough control of my phone. The only down side to this phone for me is the non removable battery. Which sucks if your phone freezes up you are helpless. This phone has not froze up on me yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Whitebread409

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT SMARTPHONE!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy with my new phone! I had no problems whatsoever, in setting it up via my wireless ISP, and AT&T traded out my old SIM card for a new Micro SIM card, for FREE! NO dropped calls, and it feels light in the hand. The keyboard is sensitive, but the key spacing is a lot better than most other phones. For a smartphone under $200, it's a GREAT investment! I'm looking forward to another 2 years of EXCELLENT cellphone service!
customer_reviews.author: J. Niccolls

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Phone
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful phone for the cost....it does deserve the title "best budget android phone". Once you buy and use it knowing that, you will be ok. If you are a power phone user, I would not recommend it. 8gb of onboard and 1 gb of memory quickly goes if you are a power user and you will quickly find your self removing apps to install another etc. I highly HIGHLY recommend buying a portable battery charger, even moderate usage will kill your battery quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Gosford Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level Android phone
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level Android phone. With minimum apps installed, my wife has gotten 3+ days of use without a charge! I'm sure if she used it like I use my phone, it wouldn't last as long, but it compares very well in general use to my Galaxy S3, but cost 1/3 the price. Highly rated by various sources, it indeed works well, has now received the coveted Lollipop upgrade without issues, and is pleasantly limited in bloatware (a few Motorola apps, but nothing from a carrier).
customer_reviews.author: G. Farney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, Its a BANG FOR YOUR BUCK. (Three things i noticed tho, 1 front facing camera is a little laggy, and 2 your lock screen cant be different than your wallpaper, 3 the emojis on here look different than regular emojis so I had to download a separate app just to see what the standard apple emojis look like) I'm Using global version on Simple Mobile in Chicago , no internet plan so the lack of LTE doesn't even matter. It has basically all the cool specs of other high end phones for only 179 $. Eff-yeah!!
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Two Moto G's Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Bought two 2nd gen moto g's- same model for my husband and me. His never worked- mine stopped working (home screen only and won't reset) within two months. My husband never got to use his - he could hear people when making calls but no one could hear him- just a noise. There are similar fixes to this online but none worked. Mine just stopped working not damaged on my end. I did buy a moto e 2nd gen ( working well - no prob YET!) and an Asus Zenphone 2- its blown the motos away. Amazon needs to assist and replace both moto g or refund, bought the insurance as well but no help there. Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: K. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Phone
customer_reviews.text: Once I got used the settings it works fine. The screen looks great and I like the size of the phone as far as holding it. I am a light user and not a pro at all but I really like this phone. It may not be as fast as the newer high dollar phones but it is OK for what I use it for. I wanted something better than a entry model and didn't want to pay hundreds so after much research I went with this phone it seems to be at the top or very close to the top of about every ones list.
customer_reviews.author: J. Throop

customer_reviews.title: and just got off the phone with the super kind and helpful motorola person
customer_reviews.text: it worked insanely well for almost a year. then today as i was out and about i got "emergency calls only" cant make calls or anything and can randomly use internet. i spent almost the whole evening trying to fix this problem, i have to be in work in the morning, and just got off the phone with the super kind and helpful motorola person, who helped me factory reset--to no avail. im incredibly saddened with this, as i cannot afford a no phone right now, and i have no idea what to do .please read all the reviews if possible, as i didnt know this phone had such issues after a while.
customer_reviews.author: catheryn williams

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for teenagers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to replace his 2 year old and dying Nexus 4. He loves it. At first he was upset about that lack of memory, but once we installed the 32GB SD card all was good. He now has tons of space for his games, videos and music. The device is well built. Battery life is much better than the Nexus 4 and most importantly it only cost me $180. He takes good care of his devices, I expect this will last him at least 2 more years.
customer_reviews.author: Errol B.

customer_reviews.title: Stock Android!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on a phone, however with the newer generation available for only slightly more money, I would recommend purchasing it. One thing to note, in addition to the specs, is that this phone has stock android with zero bloatware. My dad recently got a asus zenphone 2, which has better specs, but the phone came loaded with all kinds of junk apps and the interface was strange and counter-intuitive. Stock android is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: AM87

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by this phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone, especially for the cost. Most phones seem to be upwards of $600 now for an unlocked one. It does have it's draw backs (it isn't the fastest phone in the world) but it is certainly getting the job done for me. I was a previous iphone user that switched to android with this phone and it has been great to me. My biggest issue is that I have yet to find a real case for it. I have the flipcover that you can buy, but it makes taking pictures pretty hard. All in all it is a great phone for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Maryalice

customer_reviews.title: great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this phone I was doubtful at first because the phone didn't have 4g lte But it is just as fast. I really liked the 720p 5 inch display it is really sharp I also liked the front facing stereo speakers. My favorite feature of this phone is that is upgradeable to android 5.0 lollipop, the phone comes with android 4.4.4 kitkat out of the box but could be updated. The other thing that I liked about this phone was that it is just like a nexus it has stock android with a few Motorola apps and tweaks that actually improve the phone.
customer_reviews.author: ivelisse

customer_reviews.title: It's a great phone for the price range
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my Mother, and she absolutely loves it! It's a great phone for the price range, it allows her to have all the features of a smart phone without signing a contract and spending a fortune on something she's not convinced she needs or even wants. We were very impressed with the camera quality, and the expandable memory is great. We also loved that increase in screen size from the moto g (which I own). I thought it would feel too big, but that's hardly noticeable - what is noticeable is the giant increase in ease of use and utility.
customer_reviews.author: Ermcconn

customer_reviews.title: Great but not amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Switching from a Samsung Galaxy S4 Active on AT&T. Galaxy was always less than stellar. This doesn't have bloatware, a huge plus. Overall it works great, virtually exactly the same as my first generation Nexus tablet. Pros: affordable! No contract. No bloatware. Great basic design. Good screen. Motorola Migrate app. Cons: a few glitchy things so far. Non-removable battery. Poor WiFi reception. No LTE radio, a big con if you're a heavy data user.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Alexander

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY SLOW!
customer_reviews.text: Promted by OTA to update the device the day I got it. I updated it right away(5.0.2), what a mistake. The phone is so slow, it's practically unusable. Extreme lag, not sure if it was any better on 4.4.4, but this is just horrible. The apps crash all the time.
customer_reviews.author: dnd0220

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative to Blu
customer_reviews.text: I had a Blu phone which failed after 6 months. Seeing as the Moto G and most Blu products run in the same price point, I decided to try Motorola. Good price for performance. Probably would have been worth bumping up to LTE, but the speed is sufficient. Very little software bloat from Motorola. Have had problems with GPS, but those are more likely related to Google than hardware. A very palatable alternative to Blu phones, for price and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: it is smart to use these super motorola phones
customer_reviews.text: Using the Google-created app in partnership with Motorola that works extraordinarily under the Android system, it has no logic to spend 6 to 10 times more on an Iphone ..... Iphone had a difference that was FaceTime, but with the Whasapp and its video calling system, it is smart to use these super motorola phones .... and they are all within a range economy,
customer_reviews.author: George F.

customer_reviews.title: It is decent phone for the price. It works ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work well in the USA. This phone works on 3G. It is good only to talk. Too slow to send text messages and don't even think about sending pictures by text or email.The voice message notification stays on waaaaay too long. After a while,it makes me believe I have another new message. I hope they fix that bug.
customer_reviews.author: JRM II

customer_reviews.title: Great phone and awesome for Canadian users!
customer_reviews.text: Many critical reviews have said that this is the best sub-$200 Android phone available, and I couldn't agree more. Having owned the 1st-generation Moto G, the 2nd gen is only an improvement. The best features (versus the 1st gen, non-LTE model) are the 5" screen and the microSD slot. There doesn't seem to be a compromise in battery life despite the larger screen. In case you're wondering,the US GSM model works with ALL Canadian GSM operators (Bell, Rogers, Wind, Telus, Mobilicity, etc).
customer_reviews.author: F. lee

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: After suffering with a couple low-end Android phones, I paid just a little bit more for this, and I'm glad I did. No more constantly running out of memory and storage (I get carried away with downloading apps). No more sluggish behavior. Minimal bloatware. Respectable (for a smart phone) battery life. Regular timely Android updates (now running 5.0.2!). Sharp screen. If you want a good Android phone for under $200, this is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best deal
customer_reviews.text: It's very functional, the 1GB RAM is not a limiting factor, but the 8 GB storage is pretty limited. Android is not very polished, and the update to Android L improve it just a little. The device is pretty robust, it survived some falls. The camera is surprisingly decent for the price, just a little slow to focus. Stereo speakers are powerful. It lacks only a little in CPU power, but you cant get anything better for the price
customer_reviews.author: Marcello Tomasini

customer_reviews.title: Broken phone
customer_reviews.text: Dear sales. We bought a phone (motorola moto G) last august. The phone was functioning fine the first two months, after that it started to disfunction. in the left corner it is written No sim. We contacted the importer company here in Iceland and they informed us that there were two pins in the sim card reader that were broken. They can only send it back to the States, where it will be fixed but then the transport cost will be too much. So kindly we ask you to get back to us how we will proceed since the phone is only few months old, isn't there some sort of insurance for one year|} Please advice, Karl Svendsen
customer_reviews.author: Karl Svendsen

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had it more than a week yet.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it more than a week yet. I'm waiting for a SIM card for H2O cell system so Im not able to comment on phone use. However, when connecting to WiFi I find this phone is 'picky' about which one it accepts. At the supermarket today it couldn't connect to the free WiFi in the store, but was happy with two others across the parking lot. Same thing with my home Wifi. Go figure!
customer_reviews.author: MacBobT

customer_reviews.title: Phone works fine despite threats the app made when I removed it
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use my phone as a phone, talk and text. I have a pre paid plan and don't buy data. It does work with wifi. My biggest problem with this phone was battery life. It was draining in about 24hours. The culprit was some pre loaded app called google play service. I removed it. Phone works fine despite threats the app made when I removed it. Battery lasts along time now.
customer_reviews.author: rose97

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace my aging Samsung. I am not a high volume user and did not want to spend the $ for the "big name" phones pushed by the carriers. This is a good phone that has excellent reception in my rural area with spotty coverage. The battery life is more than adequate and the sofware is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Super, super slow
customer_reviews.text: The phone arrived in good conditional, has decent picture, and sound. The battery life is meh... I need to do a full charge twice a day. The biggest problem is the speed. WOW is this phone slow. Makes doing basic things annoying and difficult. Opening chrome takes 1 minute, doing a simple map while walking down the street takes 2 minutes. Everything. Constant lagging and slow. Makes me want to throw it against a wall, even for basic things. Forget anything complicated
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the buck
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been using this for about a year now and it has been working very well for her. She doesn't have a data plan but just uses Wifi. For calls and texting it has proven to work great and she often gets reception where my Nokia N8 doesn't. Things I would change or like to see improved would be screen brightness, a bump in base storage and a slightly higher capacity battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brad K

customer_reviews.title: Great smartphone at reasonable cost!
customer_reviews.text: Really good moderate cost phone. My first smartphone so in a steep learning curve. Best part is not paying high fees to my mobile provider, plus I have data shut off so it uses wireless exclusively till I get more familiar with the capabilities of the moto g 2nd gen. It's much faster on WiFi than my nexus 7 (2012) so I may cut that cord. I have been able to get a WiFi signal almost anywhere. I would certainly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Guinn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for $179, but not more than $200.
customer_reviews.text: At the time that I've bought this phone was less than 2 months ago, the price was $179. It is worth that because of the specs. The screen is vibrant and the speakers are loud, which surprised me. It stutters once in a while, but for $179, its worth it considering that it's unlocked. The battery lasts 6 hours with moderate use. For any more than $200 though, there are better options for a budget, decent phone.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Burress

customer_reviews.title: Died after 8 days - rather disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing - had it 8 days and the screen died. Then, the seller made me pay for return shipping for a refund. Seems like a nice phone, really like Moto, but this one was a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Moto G 2014 does not recognize SIM card (Ukraine)
customer_reviews.text: Global GSM XT1063 MSM8626BP_1032.394.88.00R Kernel 3.4.42-g668a77b System 23.11.23.titan_retuglb.en.US retus Android Kitkat 4.4.4 Hi guys, I've bought in dec14 this device on Amazon from Motorola Solutions with Global version. I've booted it just now because my friends delivered it in Ukraine. Right after starting device it does not recognize local operators SIM cards. I've tried sim cards from different operators but the result was the same. I use micro sim cards, inserting it according to instructions (contacts face to battery). Has anyone had similar issues with europe operators? Is there any solution? Or is it factory defect? Thanks in advance.
customer_reviews.author: Maks

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while then stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. I am a Moto X user and got this for my mom. Excellent call quality is the hallmark of this phone. Coming from Nokia Lumia 900, my mom was slightly disappointed in the camera, but its not that bad at all. I also added an external memory, which kept dropping occasionally, but reformatting fixed it once and for all. ---------- update 8/11/2016 The SIM Card slot has stopped working. SD Card slot keeps dropping the card and I have to always reformat. This phone has become basically useless without SIM. I am still within one year warranty hopefully the phone can be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Tejas

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase. It's a solid contender. I love that I can get 4G on MetroPCS with this thing. The 8mp camera is very nice, and that's a real plus for me. It's fast, it's big, and it's affordable. Oh, and it works really well as a phone too. I got it setup and sync'd up with my google data in just a few minutes. A winner in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Downham

customer_reviews.title: No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: Solid cheap phone. I got this phone to use with Ting. It works perfectly. If you get this phone you have to understand it is not the best, or even great... but its a strong mediocre phone. Great speakers, always have reception, day-plus of battery life, good back camera, and feels natural. The phone is heavy, which i prefer, however for a smaller hand it may be too weary.
customer_reviews.author: Zanos

customer_reviews.title: Really dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cell phone in february and last week the screen went black and the de motorola logo appeared. Nothing else but that. I tried to recovery the system buy the only phrase was: Volume down kew pressed and then boot failed. I am really dissapointed with this purchase and, of course, i dont have any warranty because i lived outside US. Today, the technical service told me that the motherboard is broken. How can it be? the cellphone has only 3 month.
customer_reviews.author: virginia

customer_reviews.title: Excelente
customer_reviews.text: The experience was good, the only bad thing is that I did not receive the cell phone that he requested, he informs me that it has been because the existence is over
customer_reviews.author: Keila

customer_reviews.title: Ordered when on sale for $99 by Amazon. Product ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered when on sale for $99 by Amazon. Product arrived with white charger for black phone. So Ok I can deal with this. Tried charging the battery, will only change to 98%. Drained and tried again and again - same result. Ok, try and get replaced. opps Can't do that. Should have just bought elsewhere, at least could get a replacement. Too late now.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Bennett

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone so far
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone so far. Battery life is really good(unless u turn on too many push notifications) and I liked the notification light that blinks for any call or message notifications. There is no 4G LTE but the data speeds so far watching youtube videos and maps are really fast. But note that US GSM version is not dual sim. Would definitely recommend this product 100% for the price it is been offered. Cheers Motorola!
customer_reviews.author: Shaan

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I say is on par with the Galaxy S3. Only thing I don't like is how fast it drains the battery even if you are not using it, and that it doesn't come with a music player installed so you have to download a third party one with ads, because who the heck wants to pay for a music player.
customer_reviews.author: The Growlanser

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after the used Nexus 5 I bought turned out to be malfunctioned and no replacement or refund was possible. Short on budget I resorted to Moto G, and now I feel I should have bought this one from the first place. It has everything. Performance is fast, screen looks good, speaker is wide and loud, and it's one of the fastest updated Android phones in the market. It's the best of the cheap Android phone, and frankly, at this price, it's almost pointless to look at flagships if you are a regular user.
customer_reviews.author: team56th

customer_reviews.title: great value!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been the proud owner of a moto g (1st gen) for the last year. Ive tried this (Moto G 2nd generation) for a few days and I still can say that this is the best value u can get for your money. very similar to the first moto G, but with larger display and microsd slots. No LTE, but this isnt a problem for me right now.
customer_reviews.author: Israel Anaya

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This phone is good at first but after a while it slows down tremendously and the apps won't work right. Maybe it's not the phone but I've got apps to debug it and it doesn't help much. If you only use your phone to call text and get on the internet occasionally this may be for you. But if you are the typical young man or woman go with a better phone such as the galaxy s6.
customer_reviews.author: cole bishop

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with TMo HSPA+, go for it
customer_reviews.text: Just want to confirm that the Global phone works at 3G/4G speeds with T-Mobile HSPA+ network (at PCS/1.9 GHz) here in US, at least in the markets that I live in - San Diego, CA and Portland, OR. I'm pretty confident it will work just as well in the other major urban areas. You can wait for the upcoming LTE version, but the pricetag will be different and the battery life is hard to predict. For what you pay now the phone is great, thank you Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Garfield

customer_reviews.title: Not as described!
customer_reviews.text: The phone I received was not unlocked, it was ATT locked. It was also for the South American market, the phone & all documents were in Spanish & couldn't be unlocked to even change the language. The box seals had been cut & an ATT seal added.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the price but after just a week ...
customer_reviews.text: Good phone for the price but after just a week screen cracked easily with just 2 feet high fall, I had the cheap AT & T Pantech phone before for long time and I dropped it hundreds of times and it never got broken.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: and I love it. Very glad I was unwilling to shell ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for a year now, and I love it. Very glad I was unwilling to shell out the money for a more expensive phone, because this phone has proven to me that I can get all the functionality I need and the quality/comfort/ease of use I want in a more reasonably-priced package.
customer_reviews.author: G. Marlow

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE! They don’t work and you won’t get a refund.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these phones and the both stopped working after 3 months. The exact same problem happened to both. When people call you, you can’t hear anything they say, but they can hear you. The phones are very low quality. DO NOT PURCHASE THEM! You only have 30 days to return and they die within 2-3 months. Customer service did not want to help.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Plugged my AT&T SIM card in and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Plugged my AT&T SIM card in and all was good. Have a generic SanDisk 32GB mini sd card that works with no problems. Texting is convenient and all options are great. I like to have the option top turn data off and it has that too. Very happy with this purchase. Shipping took a little longer than expected, but hey, it was free so cant complain much about that.
customer_reviews.author: sherf

customer_reviews.title: Great Cellphone for that price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cellphone to substitute my Note 2, while I decide for a new one. I am surprised how good the phone is, for the price I paid (110$). The screen is much faster than most cellphones I have seen (Iphone 4-5 included). Do not expect fancy things and you will be surprised for certain details on the software, over Android. If you are looking for a Cellphone that can do most of the things without problem, fast and for a small price, buy this Cellphone. 90% of the population that use smartphones, will be more than happy with this phone. Great details in the software.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro P

customer_reviews.title: This budget friendly phone has been a great find. The only thing I might do is ...
customer_reviews.text: This budget friendly phone has been a great find. The only thing I might do is add a little memory, but I love this smart phone, it gets the job done without all the cost and frills of something that you have to constantly upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone and want to buy another one. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Ring volume buggy
customer_reviews.text: Terribly bugging ring volumes. This phone works fine otherwise, but the ring and notifications always start out super quiet. You miss a lot text message notifications especially. Motorola has done nothing to fix the problem.  The screen is too big. Moto G 2013 was better overall.
customer_reviews.author: captain crunch

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great screen Big screen. Fast, intuitive operation. Inexpensive. Cons: Phone updates to Android 5.1.1. Motorola promises 6.0, but still waiting. Phone not powerful enough to show mp4 videos from microSD card -- stutters.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Motorola Moto G (2nd generation)
customer_reviews.text: Great value, prompt delivery, great packaging, item described as posted, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: eddiefig

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, no lockups
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is certainly an issue for me on this phone. If I use it a bit then I need to plan on charging, Sitting around my work desk with just texting or a few quick calls and it will last all day. Still on Android 5.0.2, though I keep hearing I will see M on it. Works fine, no lockups, pretty solid phone though and I'd buy another one again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Salgado

customer_reviews.title: Amazing phone for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great phone! if you think you need to spend a lot of $ on a phone, look no further because the Moto g 2nd gen is a nice phone for an affordable price. the 8mp camera is decent. the design doesn't feel or look cheapy at all. it exceeded my expectations for a less "fancy" phone after looking at the samsung galaxy s4 for a while. if you don't need a lot of features like eye scrolling, this phone is perfect. the battery life is okay, but gets drained faster with wifi on. Motorola has done a good job with this phone, and I would definitely recommend this phone to any age.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: To the 31 days it started to fail. The ...
customer_reviews.text: From the 31 day it started to fail. The camera is awful and doesn't focus correctly. The card reader went crazy and damaged my micro card. Finnaly the seller was not kind and I had to talk with Motorola. I have returned twice my device to Motorola and Motorola sent me a refurbished device with even more troubles. The device has scratches and big troubles in the camera, the SD reader and the ram memory. Really upset with this device and Motorola. It's the worst cell phone that I had ever. Incredibly awful and incredible how Motorola doesn't respect his customers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro V.

customer_reviews.title: great for cyanogenmod
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone specifically to run cyanogenmod. Works beautifully so far on cm12 nightly builds, just be sure to update the bootloader before installing (you'll get an error if you attempt to install with the stock bootloader). I keep wireless/data turned off most of the time unless I specifically need to use it, so my battery typically lasts 2-3 days. I mostly use the phone as a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone. I don't understand why people pay 600
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone. I don't understand why people pay 600.00 and up for a cell phone when this one does it all. My husband and myself both have this phone and we love it. Does everything, charges well, big screen,great pictures(not as great as the iphone pics". I'd give it ten stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: but externally it doesn't look like it. It's not as snappy as higher end ...
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely a budget smartphone, but externally it doesn't look like it. It's not as snappy as higher end phones and it is short on storage. However, it looks like it is worth more than it is and is very functional for standard smartphone use (email, web browsing, Facebook etc.). For the price it is well worth it to use on a cheaper service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of box
customer_reviews.text: The camera never worked on this phone. It also wouldn't read SD cards, so I couldn't add memory, which meant the phone was pretty much only good for making calls. A flip phone can do that. I'm only making this review now as I have come to realize Amazon is flooded with fake products. I always blamed Motorola, but it may have been a knockoff from Amazon. I'm leery of purchasing anything on Amazon anymore outside of books.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device so far
customer_reviews.text: Update: Shells and protective covers are now being sold in Argentina, so don't bother about buying one at amazon if you don't want to buy the bundle pack. Also, keep in mind that this i NOT a 4G phone. So you won't be able to use the slowly-emerging argentine 4G network. I bought the Global GSM and works perfectly with Personal Argentina. For those who live in Argentina and plan to buy one of this abroad, remember to buy a protective shell or a cover, as you won't found one that fit this model here. Great device so far. Screen is crystal clear and the speakers are the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Giudice

customer_reviews.title: Overall is still a good phone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall is still a good phone for the price, sadly from day one some problems about the battery arise, it takes ages to charge, I used one plus one charger and that was faster so probably the charger has too few amps, also the phone discharged by itself so battery lasted as little as five hours stand by, less if being used and was very hot, the os could be blamed for that since Google Services was the number one user of batter and keep the phone awake most of the time, probably another os like cyanogen would have solved it, but anyway I was not in the mood to try and void the warranty
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great Screen...and that's about it!
customer_reviews.text: Very low storage capability. Very low RAM. Low quality processor. Very nice screen. If you just need a cheap phone and don't plan on downloading many apps or doing anything crazy with it, not a bad choice. But compared to the phones on the market today this is way down the line in the performance category.
customer_reviews.author: thedudeabides

customer_reviews.title: Sound is pretty good. Price is right
customer_reviews.text: I'm a normal phone user. it screen is a about 1/3 inches longer than iPhone 5S. Apps run really really fast. Phone is not heavy. Sound is pretty good. Price is right. Motorola is in the right direction on this phone. Very happy with the this purchase. 3G only but it is fine with me. Strongly recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.author: C_Ng

customer_reviews.title: i'm very happy! I use in japan
customer_reviews.text: This is really good smart phone and greatprice. battery life; i've used a 3.5 hour on front light . I was using a web browser and some apps between. battery remaining after 20 hours was 15%! then cut the 15% when the battery saver start. This phone is great if you can a some compromise on camera function. The back of the design is a great and cute. i changed shell case it to blue、 I'm very happy! For use in Japan; docomo fomaプラスエリアでは使えないようです.私はIIJMIOのみおフォンでつかってます。 APN設定もされていてシムカードをさすだけで使えました。日本語も装備されていましたが入力はgoogle入力アプリなどをplay storeからダウンロードする必要がありました。余計なアプリがプリインストールされてないので動作も軽く快適に使えています。カメラ性能はiPhoneなどの高級機とはサスガに違いますが大変気に入っています!
customer_reviews.author: Yuji Y.

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto G (2nd generation) Unlocked Cellphone, 8GB, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Global GSMChoose a brilliant display, stereo sound, all-day battery, and latest Android OS. Your choice: the MOTO G 2nd Generation.
feature_bullets: Optimized to work with 3G (UMTS/HSPA+) networks when roaming outside the US. Only supports 2G coverage on T-Mobile
This device is shipped with a wall charger included

Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.
Optimized to work with 3G (UMTS/HSPA+) networks when roaming outside the US. This product is not LTE(4G) enabled.
Qualcomm Snapdragon 400 processor with 1.2 GHz quad-core CPU
Android 4.4, KitKat with guaranteed upgrade,All-day 2,070 mAh battery, Corning Gorilla glass 3, water-resistant splash guard
Box contents: Motorola Moto G (2nd generation), wall charger, quick guides

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,464 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Touchscreen, Built-in-gps, Bluetooth-enabled, Dual-camera, Lte, Smartphone
